c74object.name: randdist
c74object.digest: Employ a variety of random distributions
c74object.description: Generate random numbers with a variety of distributions

method.name: bang
method.description: Generate a random number, based on the distribution defined. Default is uniform.

method.name: distlist
method.description: This message tells randdist to output a list of numbers instead of a single float. The elements in the list represent separate queries of a type of randomness. This can be useful for outputting a topology of values based on a specific distribution.

method.name: float
method.description: Scalar for the random numbers generated when randdist receives a bang.

method.name: int
method.description: An int has the same effect as the [distlist] message.

method.name: loadbang
method.description: If this message is issued after randdist is instantiated, the object will store the current seed status for the next time that the patch is loaded. This can be useful in generated predictable behavior and shapes.

method.name: nonparametric
method.description: The non-parameteric message allows the user to draw/edit their own distribution. For each list element that is input, thre is an index and a weight. The index is a chosen value, and the weight is how frequently that value is chosen. A value of 1. equates to that index being chosen most of the time. A value of zero will not allow the index to appear in the output. If there are more than one non-zero values in the list, the probability is shared between them. Example: the list [0. 0. 1. 0. 0.1] will output a zero (2) most of the time, and every once in a while will output a 4.

method.name: tellmeeverything
method.description: Output all information about the object's state to the Max window.

method.name: version
method.description: Print version information to the Max window.

method.name: gaussian
method.description: The normal distribution. A common probability-based distribution. Read more here.

method.name: gaussian_tail
method.description: The normal distribution with a decay-tail property. Read more here and here.

method.name: bivariate_gaussian
method.description: Returns a pair of random deviates from within the boundaries of sigma x and y, respectively. rho is a correlation measure between the two for what is returned, and should lie between 1 and -1. Read more here.

method.name: exponential
method.description: Describes the time between events in a Poisson point process. Read more here.

method.name: erlang
method.description: A two-parameter probability distribution. The first is a positive integer, and the second a positive real number.

method.name: laplace
method.description: The "double exponential distribution". This distribution is basically a mirror of two exponential distibutions. The width is representative of the spread in the exponential function(s) that is drawn from when numbers are generated.

method.name: exppow
method.description: This function returns a random variate from the exponential power distribution with scale parameter and exponent. The scale is the height of the maximum returned value, and the exponent is how tightly fitted the sigmoid is as it hovers around zero.

method.name: cauchy
method.description: The distribution of the ratio of independent normally distributed random variables. Read more here.

method.name: rayleigh
method.description: Sigma is equivalent to a scale parameter.

method.name: rayleigh_tail
method.description: Similar to the rayleigh distribution, but with a lower limit of 'a'.

method.name: landau
method.description: A probability distribution with a "fat tail" along the x axis. Mean/variance are undefined.

method.name: levy
method.description: A probability distribution for a non-negative variable. Read more here.

method.name: levy_skew
method.description: The levy distribution with skew applied. Skew (skewness) must be a float between -1. and 1.

method.name: gamma
method.description: The alpha parameter shapes the function drawn from and beta functions as a rate parameter. Read more here.

method.name: uniform
method.description: Equally probability distribution. 'a' and 'b' represent the locations on the x axis in which the number will be generated. Read more here.

entry.name: Inlet 1 [anything]
entry.description: Send a message to the randdist object.

entry.name: Outlet 1 [list or float]
entry.description: Generated numbers as either a single float or list of floats.
